title: Activity-Based Embedded Systems Remote Education Design

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational electronics engineering and programming experience
context.additional_context: Real-time online collaborative environment utilizing hands-on practice kits

learning_goals: Learners can independently configure an embedded system development toolchain
Learners can design debugging procedures for resolving hardware-software integration issues
Learners can write C-based firmware required for real-time embedded system operations

Learners design an embedded algorithm executable on an ARM Cortex-M4 microcontroller (128KB RAM, 80MHz) within one week, implement it in C code meeting memory usage ≤80KB and real-time processing latency ≤100ms, and submit performance test results.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
